intro: Cyphonema buchananii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, waxy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a contrasting throat. Cyphonema buchananii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
